intro: Psychotria brevipuberula, commonly known as the short-hairy psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are covered in short, stiff hairs. It produces small, white to pale green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. This species is often found growing in shaded, moist environments and is not widely cultivated outside its native range.
